item.title: Absorbing State Transitions
item.description: An absorbing state (AS) is a state which can not be escaped once entered. If we imagine a Markov chain, then the absorbing state is one which has no outgoing transitions. AS transitions are an example of a non-equilibrium phase transition. In analogy to equilibrium phase transisitions, we can define...
